Name: Naos of Amasis the Second Dedicated to Neith
Description: This naos, built by King Amasis the Second in Memphis, was dedicated to goddess Neith. Its surface is rough and there are no traces of reliefs on either the inner or outer walls. The naos top is round and the entrance is decorated with a cornice over a large winged sun disk between two uraei, or royal cobras. Hieroglyphics on each side of the entrance list the Horus name and the throne name of the king in between the sign for sky at the top, and a vertical line representing earth at the bottom.
